Lack of audience engagement: Building and maintaining an audience can be difficult, especially in the early stages of a podcast. It may take time to develop a loyal listenership, and the content may not be appealing to everyone.
Competition: With the rise of podcasts, there is a lot of competition in the market. It can be challenging to stand out and differentiate oneself from other podcasts.
Consistency: Regularly releasing new episodes can be difficult, especially when dealing with busy schedules or technical issues.

Low production costs: Starting a podcast can be expensive, and the costs may not be covered by advertising revenue alone. This can be a challenge for those who want to create high-quality content without sacrificing quality.
Distribution: Getting a podcast to reach a wide audience can be difficult, especially if the platform being used has limitations or restrictions.
